text:
The 2021 CXO Tech Agenda study,
by the Wall Street Journal

and Barron’s Group, stated that “51
percent of respondents

ranked new technology
piloting and adoption as the

greatest transformation
initiative for the years ahead.”

Indeed. Technology in general
plays a major role in helping

Chief marketing officers
(CMOs) and their teams manage
and drive the customer experience.

To get started on your digital
transformation journey,

first evaluate
your marketing technology

(MarTech) stack, and identify
which tools are essential
and which ones can be avoided.

When evaluating your MarTech
stack, it’s important to consider

each tool individually
for its impact, usage, adoption,

integration, investment,
and so on.

Then, map out how
they integrate with one another

and how they fit into your overall
marketing strategy.

Ensure that
they can help you achieve
your business goals.

You can optimize your 
stack using various third-party

software, integrations, and
machine learning (ML) technology as well as employing
professional services.

By optimizing your MarTech
stack, you will

increase 
ROI on your team’s go-to-market
efforts.

When adopting technologies
that your team hasn’t used before,

such as artificial intelligence
(AI), ML, or various cloud

tools, be sure to identify
and close your team’s skills
gaps.

You can partner with your
peers to access their technical
talents.

This can include chief data
officers (CDOs), chief information

officers (CIOs), and chief
technology officers (CTOs).

You should partner with your chief
information security officers

(CISOs) for expertise in cloud
data security to protect

customer privacy, improve
the user experience,

and make sure it meets different
regulatory industry requirements.

In addition, we recommend
hiring at least one technical

marketing program manager
to manage any marketing

technology migrations
or implementations.

This might include moving
from one customer relationship

management (CRM) solution
to another.

For more information
on this topic, check out the
links in the description.
Thanks for watching.
